<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 690, 90]]<|/det|>
A student is investigating the conduction of thermal energy by metals.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 863, 121]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment to compare the rates at which different metals conduct thermal energy.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 522, 152]]<|/det|>
You are **not** required to carry out the experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 166, 398, 183]]<|/det|>
The apparatus available includes:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 197, 596, 214]]<|/det|>
strips of different metals, shaped as shown in Fig. 4.1

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 214, 388, 229]]<|/det|>
a test-tube in a clamp stand

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 229, 233, 244]]<|/det|>
a beaker

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 244, 339, 260]]<|/det|>
a supply of cold water

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 259, 336, 275]]<|/det|>
a supply of hot water.
